alert.note: Alert for Rogers (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 23 at 6:10PM CDT until March 23 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Oklahoma, including the following counties, Delaware, Mayes, Rogers and Wagoner. * WHEN...Until 915 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 608 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Claremore... Jay... Pryor... Owasso... Pryor Creek... Catoosa... Grove... Verdigris... Chouteau... Inola... Locust Grove... Salina... Langley... Adair... Spavinaw... Foyil... Disney... Pensacola... Hoot Owl... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
